result.execSummary:
The defendant Alvis C. Winters Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
-------------------------------------

Absolute sobriety. No alcohol. No drugs or drug paraphernalia.
-------------------------------------

Complete AODA assessment andand any recommended treatment or follow up. 
-------------------------------------
Follow through with any other counseling or treatment needs as identified by Agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alvis C. Winters Sr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
2:34 p.m.  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Alvis C. Winters in court, in custody with Atty Francis P Raff.  
Matter is before the Court for a sentencing hearing.  
Court recites charge and maximum potential penalties.  
Deft is acknowledging prior 2012 felony drug conviction in Lincoln Co. to support the repeater enhancer.  
Court has reviewed the PSI.  Atty Raff didn't receive a copy of the PSI until today but indicates it appears to be an update of a prior PSI.  Mr. Winters has advised Atty Raff that he is aware of the contents of the PSI and does not need additional time to review it with Atty Raff.  Atty Raff advises Court that the parties have a joint recommendation as to sentence.  
Response by Mr. Winters to Court's questions.  Mr. Winters does wish to jointly recommend this agreement to the Court.  Deft makes statement of apology.  
2:41 pm  Court notes PSI writer is recommending a much higher sentence then what the parties have agreed upon but Court makes record that she believes the joint recommendation is appropriate.  

SENTENCE:
Total length of sentence is 3 years
18 months of IC followed by 18 months of ES
Sixty-four (64) days of sentence credit (12/6/2015 - 02/08/2016)

CONDITIONS OF ES:  
1)  Absolute sobriety.  No alcohol.  No drugs or drug paraphernalia.  
2)  No weapons.  
3)  Pay court costs and DOC supervision fees.  
4)  Complete an AODA assessment and any recommended treatment or follow up.  
5)  Follow through with any other counseling or treatment needs as identified by Agent.  

Court finds deft eligible for CIP and SAP  

2:45 pm  Court in recess.
Sentencing hearing on September 16, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Original Writ filed with the court.
Order for Defendant's Appearance at Department of Corrections for Pre-Sentence Investigation Report

records.addlTxt: Defendant Alvis C. Winters in court, in custody with attorney Francis P Raff.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.

Defendant Alvis C. Winters in court with attorney Francis P Raff.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alvis C. Winters in court, in custody with attorney Francis P Raff.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered. Motion deadline 03/01/2016. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
